instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Late 2013 - turns itself off after some time/usage
threads.message:
Happy new year to everyone! Health first, then everything else.

As for this board, I've been reading in forums that these could be "just" bad design. 

Is there anything that I could measure/diagnose in order to see what is going on? 
Honestly, I haven't got the board out yet, but I'll inspect it soon.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Late 2013 - turns itself off after some time/usage
threads.message:
If is the (in)famous <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MLB, you can try to replace all FDMF6808 with new FDMF6708.
Don't waste time trying to find real "new" original chips; all of them are fake...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Late 2013 - turns itself off after some time/usage
threads.message: So to replace <CHIP>U7310</CHIP>/20/30 best is to use them from other donor board, is that what you're saying?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Late 2013 - turns itself off after some time/usage
threads.message:
That is not the best solution.
You can got same issue too.
Buy new FDMF6708 from Mouser, or other serious webstore.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Late 2013 - turns itself off after some time/usage
threads.message: How are the experiences with new chips? Anyone had luck resolving the issue?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Late 2013 - turns itself off after some time/usage
threads.message:
Okay, new 6708 installed. Before it would shut down every hour, now it is already on for several hours without shutting down. 

Do you remove CPU heatsink prior to IC's replacement or you leave it on?
